Secure Autonomy. Tactical Advantage

Crydon Defense Systems Inc. is a U.S.-owned small business focused on unmanned autonomy and defense solutions. We work across research, prototyping, and integration to help programs move quickly from requirements to real test outcomes.
Crydon Defense Systems Inc. is structured to support rapid prototyping and transition to production for U.S. Department of Defense programs.
Crydon is committed to compliant and responsible engineering for defense and aerospace missions.
Crydon Defense Systems Inc. delivers engineering and prototyping for unmanned aerial systems and autonomous flight technologies with an emphasis on resilient integration and mission-ready results.
Crydon supports mission-aligned engineering with autonomy and integration that maps to operational realities.
Crydon Defense Systems Inc. is committed to delivering reliable engineering outcomes for mission-oriented programs.
Crydon is committed to compliant and responsible engineering for defense and aerospace missions.
If you’re exploring a new unmanned capability, autonomy upgrade, payload integration, or communications architecture, we can help you move from concept to prototype quickly.

Crydon products are delivered as mission-ready modules, reference designs, and integration kits that accelerate program schedules. Availability and configuration depend on mission requirements and compliance constraints.

Crydon Defense Systems Inc. delivers mission-oriented R&D, autonomy integration, communications architectures, and payload integration — with a test-first workflow and predictable delivery artifacts. Capabilities Overview Contact

UAS R&D and rapid prototyping Baseline platforms and rapid iterations aligned to program constraints, schedules, and test events. Autonomy integration Behavior integration, safety constraints, and interfaces to autopilot and mission software. LOS/BLOS communications architectures Reference architectures and integration planning for resilient connectivity (program constraints apply). Payload integration Mechanical/electrical/software integration patterns to reduce interface and integration risk. Test campaigns and iteration loops Test planning, instrumentation, evidence capture, reporting, and follow-on improvements. Transition support Documentation, baselines, and handoff artifacts to support downstream teams and production readiness.

documents.t: Crydon Defense Systems Inc. is a U.S.-owned small business focused on unmanned autonomy and defense solutions. We work across research, prototyping, and integration to help programs move quickly from requirements to real test outcomes.
Deliver resilient autonomy and integration capabilities that create operational advantage — with speed, discipline, and engineering clarity.
We design systems that can be fielded rapidly, improved iteratively, and tuned through operator feedback — without overcomplicating the solution.

Clear requirements and mission constraints Short build-test-learn loops Integration-first engineering (flight controls, comms, payloads) Documentation and delivery discipline suitable for defense programs
Crydon Defense Systems Inc. is structured to support rapid prototyping and transition to production for U.S. Department of Defense programs.
Business Size: Small Business (SBA) Entity Type: U.S. C-Corp (Not Tax-Exempt) Year Incorporated: 2025 SAM.gov: Registered UEI: ER13XF6JSQ64 CAGE: 15L43
U.S.-owned and controlled by a U.S. person No foreign ownership, control, or influence (no FOCI) Eligible under 10 U.S.C. §4022 as a nontraditional defense contractor
541715 – R&D in Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (Primary) 336411 – Aircraft Manufacturing 334511 – Navigation, Guidance, Control Instruments Manufacturing 541330 – Engineering Services
AJ13 / AJ14 / AJ15 – Aerospace R&D (Applied, Engineering, Operational) 1510 / 1520 – Aircraft (Fixed / Rotary Wing) 1550 / 1680 – UAV Components & Accessories R425 – Engineering / Technical Services
Crydon is committed to compliant and responsible engineering for defense and aerospace missions.
We support program needs with careful handling of controlled technical data and export-sensitive information.
We apply cybersecurity hygiene appropriate for sensitive engineering work, including access control, least-privilege workflows, and secure collaboration practices.
We minimize exposure of mission data, control distribution, and maintain clear data-handling processes aligned with customer requirements.
Crydon Defense Systems Inc. delivers engineering and prototyping for unmanned aerial systems and autonomous flight technologies with an emphasis on resilient integration and mission-ready results.

Research, design, and development of UAS and autonomy Advanced flight control systems and autopilot software integration LOS/BLOS communications and data link architectures Systems engineering, rapid prototyping, and payload integration Mission applications: ISR (intelligence, surveillance, reconnaissance) Disaster response Border security Maritime monitoring

Founder-led team with 15+ years of UAV R&D and defense innovation Expertise in long-endurance, high-altitude UAV programs and resilient avionics Agile small business structure enabling rapid prototyping and cost-effective delivery Prior success with SBIR-class efforts, DoD collaborations, and international test campaigns Strong commitment to ITAR compliance, cybersecurity practices, and sensitive data handling
Crydon supports mission-aligned engineering with autonomy and integration that maps to operational realities.
Platform and payload integration support for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance workflows.
Rapid deployable capabilities: mapping, monitoring, and coordination support.
Persistent monitoring concepts and scalable unmanned solutions.
Long-range mission concepts, resilient connectivity planning, and sensor integration patterns.
Crydon Defense Systems Inc. is committed to delivering reliable engineering outcomes for mission-oriented programs.

Requirements traceability: define what “done” means early Verification-first mindset: plan tests as we design Configuration discipline: document changes and baselines Integration readiness: reduce surprises at test events Continuous improvement: iterate based on test evidence and user feedback
We identify technical and schedule risks early and propose mitigation options with transparent tradeoffs.
Crydon is committed to compliant and responsible engineering for defense and aerospace missions.
We support program needs with careful handling of controlled technical data and export-sensitive information.
We apply cybersecurity hygiene appropriate for sensitive engineering work, including access control, least-privilege workflows, and secure collaboration practices.
We minimize exposure of mission data, control distribution, and maintain clear data-handling processes aligned with customer requirements.
If you’re exploring a new unmanned capability, autonomy upgrade, payload integration, or communications architecture, we can help you move from concept to prototype quickly.

Mission context (e.g., ISR, maritime, disaster response) Desired range/endurance/altitude constraints (if applicable) Payload type (EO/IR, comms relay, radar, custom) Integration environment (GCS, existing autopilot, data links) Timeline and test constraints (lab, field, flight)
documents.s: What to include in your message

documents.t: We reply with a short set of technical questions and propose a next step: Discovery call → NDA (if required) → concept brief → prototype plan.

Crydon products are delivered as mission-ready modules, reference designs, and integration kits that accelerate program schedules. Availability and configuration depend on mission requirements and compliance constraints.
A scalable UAV reference baseline intended for rapid iteration and payload experimentation. Typical uses Training & evaluation ISR payload integration demonstrations Rapid mission prototyping

A packaged approach to integrate and validate autonomy behaviors with common autopilot ecosystems and mission logic. Includes Integration patterns and interfaces Safety and operational constraints Validation approach aligned with test events
Reference architectures and integration support for LOS/BLOS connectivity (subject to program constraints).
Reusable mechanical/electrical/software patterns to integrate sensors and mission payloads quickly with reduced integration risk.
